body:
Yandex (Russian google) is advertising their new translate system. And while it's not clear if they use SYSTRAN for translation like the rest (Google, Bing, Bable Fish) did, or rolled out their own SMT, they certainly merit a test drive.

Let's try translating a famous Russian pangram (not really, no ж) to English
— Съешь ещё этих мягких французских булок, да выпей чаю.

Correct translation
— Eat more of these soft French rolls and drink tea.

Yandex
— Eat more of these soft French rolls lazy.
Apparently, drinking tea is considered a lazy pastime by Yandex.

Bing
— Eat more of these soft French rolls, so drink some tea.

Google
— Eat more of these soft French rolls, but drink tea.

It seems they all have either their own translation engines or a very different training set. Google being probably the closest to correct translation.
